<tal:block tal:replace="nothing"
 xmlns:tal="http://xml.zope.org/namespaces/tal"
 xmlns:metal="http://xml.zope.org/namespaces/metal"
 xmlns:i18n="http://xml.zope.org/namespaces/i18n"><!--
 * Note: If this template is not working, look at erp5_xhtml_style/template_erp5_xhtml_style
 which is the equivalent of this erp5_web_default_template page template in default
 erp5 xhtml style.
 * XXX Is it a good idea to merge this header with th one in template_erp5_xhtml_style ?
 --></tal:block>
 
 <tal:block metal:define-macro="master">
 
 <tal:block metal:use-macro="here/global_definitions/macros/header_definitions"/>
 
 <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
 
 <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en" lang="en">
 <head tal:define="dummy python: request.RESPONSE.setHeader('Content-Type', 'text/html;; charset=utf-8')">
 <base tal:attributes="href python: '%s/' % here.getWebSiteValue().absolute_url()"/>
 <meta name="generator" content="ERP5"/>
 <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"/>
 <title tal:content="python: '%s | %s' % (here.getTitleOrId(), here.getPortalObject().getTitle() or here.getPortalObject().getId())"/>
 
 <!-- erp5_web_form.css is a constant among erp5 web themes -->
 <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" media="screen" href="erp5_web_form.css"/>
 
 <tal:block tal:repeat="css css_list">
 <link tal:attributes="href css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet"/>
 </tal:block>
 
 <script type="text/javascript">
 // The first input element with a "autofocus" class will get the focus,
 // else, the first input is choosen.
 function autoFocus() {
 var inputs = document.getElementsByTagName("input");
 var input_to_focus = inputs[0];
 for (i=0;i<inputs.length;i++) {
 if (inputs[i].className == "autofocus") {
 input_to_focus = inputs[i];
 }
 }
 input_to_focus.focus();
 }
 </script>
 
 <tal:block tal:repeat="js js_list">
 <script tal:attributes="src js" type="text/javascript"></script>
 </tal:block>
 
 <!-- TODO: No local JS and/or CSS file support yet: they should be registered via
 generic mechanism and put in css_list and js_list above. -->
 <tal:block metal:define-slot="erp5_web_template_head"/>
 
 <tal:block metal:use-macro="here/global_definitions/macros/planning_box_definitions"/>
 </head>
 
 <body> <!-- TODO: This conflicts with tabber.js => onload="autoFocus()"-->
 <!-- Global form is used to save data of other fields when we edit one another (generally make sense in listbox and/or relation string field) -->
 <form id="main_form"
 tal:attributes="enctype python: here.ERP5XhtmlStyle_getFormEnctype(form);
 action url;
 method form/method | string:post">
 
 <tal:block metal:use-macro="here/global_definitions/macros/http_definitions"/>
 
 <!-- Main content rendering -->
 <!-- Here we force the editable_mode variable to True to let the layout and widgets based on forms be rendered as editable or non-editable according the "editable" property on fields.
 XXX However this hasa bad side effect: the editable_mode variable in request is force to True and is no longer representative of the web site mode.
 -->
 <tal:block tal:define="dummy python: request.set('editable_mode', True)">
 <tal:block metal:define-slot="erp5_web_template_main_content"/>
 </tal:block>
 
 </form>
 </body>
 </html>
 </tal:block>
